meaning: a momentary trance of emotional clarity
longing for the clarity of disaster
the awareness of how little we really know
the awareness that you are not at home in the wilderness
the awareness of how little of the world you’ll experience
the desire to keep going when you feel like giving up
the fear of being trapped in a crowd
the sudden clarity that comes in the dark just before falling asleep
frustration of photographic originality
a sense of boredom with familiar places
the bittersweet awareness that all things must end
the reluctance to change your life, even when it’s not working
the feeling of having grown into a person you didn’t expect
a smile that masks what you’re really feeling
the sense that time keeps accelerating as you age
curiosity about the impact you've had on the lives of people you know
the feeling of emptiness after a long and arduous process is finally complete
the sadness that there's no way to convey a powerful memory to people who weren't there
a wistful omen of the first sign of autumn, a subtle coolness in the shadows
the mystery of what goes on behind the scenes of your social life
the realization that each passerby has a life as complex as your own
the ambiguous intensity of looking someone in the eye
the subtle but persistent feeling of being out of place
the eerie, forlorn atmosphere of a place that's usually bustling but is now abandoned
the amniotic tranquility of being indoors during a thunderstorm
the wish that the modern world felt as epic as the one depicted in old stories and folktales
astonished to think back on the bizarre sequence of accidents that brought you to where you are today
the state of not knowing how you really feel about something
a friendship that can lie dormant for years only to pick right back up instantly
the tranquil pleasure of being near a gathering but not quite in it
weariness with the same old issues that you've always had
proud of a scar on your body
the moment a conversation becomes real and alive
a feature of modern society that suddenly strikes you as absurd and grotesque
a state of exhaustion inspired by an act of senseless violence
the desire to be struck by disaster
the tendency to give up trying to talk about an experience because people are unable to relate to it
the moment of realization that your quintessential future self isn't ever going to show up
the awareness of the smallness of your perspective
the realization that the plot of your life doesn't make sense to you anymore
the desire to care less about things
the strange wistfulness of used bookstores
the desire that memory could flow backward
frustration with how long it takes to get to know someone
a sadness that you'll never be able to know how history will turn out
